item.title: Callbacks suck, async is easy
item.author: team@silocitylabs.com (Silo City Labs)
item.description: I’m using PouchDB lately, a JavaScript database that works in the browser. PouchDB for Javascript requires callbacks and I found myself stacking quite a bit of JS-specific syntax together. I haven’t written JS in quite a while so this was daunting. Lets go through all the pieces that add up to easy async database calls. Synchronous PHP example Here is a PHP sample of accessing a database. $couch = new CouchClient('http://localhost:5984', 'my_database'); $helloWorld = [ '_id' => '001', 'title' => 'Hello World' ]; $couch->storeDoc($helloWorld); // Save the document to CouchDB $doc = $couch->getDoc('001'); echo $doc->title; // outputs 'Hello World' echo "End"; Each command runs serially, one after the other.
